11#ifndef MODULES_AUDIO_CODING_NETEQ_DELAY_MANAGER_H_
12#define MODULES_AUDIO_CODING_NETEQ_DELAY_MANAGER_H_
13
14#include <string.h> // Provide access to size_t.
15
16#include <deque>
17#include <memory>
18
19#include "absl/types/optional.h"
20#include "api/neteq/tick_timer.h"
21#include "modules/audio_coding/neteq/histogram.h"
22#include "rtc_base/constructor_magic.h"
23
24namespace webrtc {
25
26class DelayManager {
27 public:
28 DelayManager(int max_packets_in_buffer,
29 int base_minimum_delay_ms,
30 int histogram_quantile,
31 absl::optional<int> resample_interval_ms,
32 int max_history_ms,
33 const TickTimer* tick_timer,
34 std::unique_ptr<Histogram> histogram);
35
36 // Create a DelayManager object. Notify the delay manager that the packet
37 // buffer can hold no more than |max_packets_in_buffer| packets (i.e., this
38 // is the number of packet slots in the buffer) and that the target delay
39 // should be greater than or equal to |base_minimum_delay_ms|. Supply a
40 // PeakDetector object to the DelayManager.
41 static std::unique_ptr<DelayManager> Create(int max_packets_in_buffer,
42 int base_minimum_delay_ms,
43 const TickTimer* tick_timer);
44
45 virtual ~DelayManager();
46
47 // Updates the delay manager with a new incoming packet, with |timestamp| from
48 // the RTP header. This updates the statistics and a new target buffer level
49 // is calculated. Returns the relative delay if it can be calculated. If
50 // |reset| is true, restarts the relative arrival delay calculation from this
51 // packet.
52 virtual absl::optional<int> Update(uint32_t timestamp,
53 int sample_rate_hz,
54 bool reset = false);
55
56 // Resets all state.
57 virtual void Reset();
58
59 // Gets the target buffer level in milliseconds.
60 virtual int TargetDelayMs() const;
61
62 // Notifies the DelayManager of how much audio data is carried in each packet.
63 virtual int SetPacketAudioLength(int length_ms);
64
65 // Accessors and mutators.
66 // Assuming |delay| is in valid range.
67 virtual bool SetMinimumDelay(int delay_ms);
68 virtual bool SetMaximumDelay(int delay_ms);
69 virtual bool SetBaseMinimumDelay(int delay_ms);
70 virtual int GetBaseMinimumDelay() const;
71
72 // These accessors are only intended for testing purposes.
73 int effective_minimum_delay_ms_for_test() const {
74 return effective_minimum_delay_ms_;
75 }
76 int histogram_quantile() const { return histogram_quantile_; }
77 Histogram* histogram() const { return histogram_.get(); }
78
79 private:
80 // Provides value which minimum delay can't exceed based on current buffer
81 // size and given |maximum_delay_ms_|. Lower bound is a constant 0.
82 int MinimumDelayUpperBound() const;
83
84 // Updates |delay_history_|.
85 void UpdateDelayHistory(int iat_delay_ms,
86 uint32_t timestamp,
87 int sample_rate_hz);
88
89 // Calculate relative packet arrival delay from |delay_history_|.
90 int CalculateRelativePacketArrivalDelay() const;
91
92 // Updates |effective_minimum_delay_ms_| delay based on current
93 // |minimum_delay_ms_|, |base_minimum_delay_ms_| and |maximum_delay_ms_|
94 // and buffer size.
95 void UpdateEffectiveMinimumDelay();
96
97 // Makes sure that |delay_ms| is less than maximum delay, if any maximum
98 // is set. Also, if possible check |delay_ms| to be less than 75% of
99 // |max_packets_in_buffer_|.
100 bool IsValidMinimumDelay(int delay_ms) const;
101
102 bool IsValidBaseMinimumDelay(int delay_ms) const;
103
104 bool first_packet_received_;
105 // TODO(jakobi): set maximum buffer delay instead of number of packets.
106 const int max_packets_in_buffer_;
107 std::unique_ptr<Histogram> histogram_;
108 const int histogram_quantile_;
109 const TickTimer* tick_timer_;
110 const absl::optional<int> resample_interval_ms_;
111 const int max_history_ms_;
112
113 int base_minimum_delay_ms_;
114 int effective_minimum_delay_ms_; // Used as lower bound for target delay.
115 int minimum_delay_ms_; // Externally set minimum delay.
116 int maximum_delay_ms_; // Externally set maximum allowed delay.
117
118 int packet_len_ms_ = 0;
119 std::unique_ptr<TickTimer::Stopwatch>
120 packet_iat_stopwatch_; // Time elapsed since last packet.
121 int target_level_ms_; // Currently preferred buffer level.
122 uint32_t last_timestamp_; // Timestamp for the last received packet.
123 int num_reordered_packets_ = 0;
124 int max_delay_in_interval_ms_ = 0;
125 std::unique_ptr<TickTimer::Stopwatch> resample_stopwatch_;
126
127 struct PacketDelay {
128 int iat_delay_ms;
129 uint32_t timestamp;
130 };
131 std::deque<PacketDelay> delay_history_;
132
133 RTC_DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN(DelayManager);
134};
135
136} // namespace webrtc
137#endif // MODULES_AUDIO_CODING_NETEQ_DELAY_MANAGER_H_
138
